org.project

Class HTTPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.project.HTTPClient

  • public final class HTTPClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to create an HTTP client capable of using the HTTP method "GET" to retrieve the content of a web page. Its features are setting URL, getting the response string and closing the connection. NOTE: This class is a wrapper that contains the HTTP client from the package org.apache.http.impl.client CloseableHttpClient.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient client
      This is the HTTP client.
      private boolean connected
      This variable is used to tell whether the Client is connected or not in a given moment .
      private int CORRECT_STATUS
      This is the value of a correctly initialized connection.
      private org.apache.http.client.methods.HttpGet request
      This is the variable that stores all the information related to the request.
      private org.apache.http.client.methods.CloseableHttpResponse response
      This is the variable that holds the response of the web page.
      private int TIMEOUT
      This is the max value of time (ms) given to the connection, the connection request, socket, and cookie specification.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HTTPClient()
      This constructor sets the connection and stores all the data related to it (client).
      HTTPClient(org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient client)
      This constructor sets the internal client to the one passed as argument client).

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPClient

        public HTTPClient()
        This constructor sets the connection and stores all the data related to it (client).

      • HTTPClient

        public HTTPClient(org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient client)
        This constructor sets the internal client to the one passed as argument client). This allows any user to set the client with custom configuration.
        Parameters:
        client - which is the client to use to actually get a connection

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(java.net.URL url)
             throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to connect the set HTTP client with a given site URL.
        Parameters:
        url - which is the URL of the Web page.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the TIMEOUT for connection is surpassed.

      • getHttpString

        public java.lang.String getHttpString()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to get the response of the web page to the HTTP client request
        Returns:
        a String containing the response of the web page to the HTTP client request.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the connection was not possible.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the HTTP client client is not connected.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method checks to see if the connection is open and then closes it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the client and response connection closure was not possible.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        This method is used to know whether the client is connected or not.
        Returns:
        true if the HTTP client is connected, else return false.
